citation.article-title: Euzebyella saccharophila gen. nov., sp. nov., a marine bacterium of the family Flavobacteriaceae
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Euzebyella (Eu.ze.by′el.la. N.L. fem. n. Euzebyella named after the French microbiologist J. P. Euzéby, for his outstanding contribution to the nomenclature of Prokaryotes and to bacterial taxonomy in general).
Gram-negative, aerobic, mesophilic, chemo-organotrophic, slightly halophilic, pigmented bacteria.
No growth can be observed without seawater or without the addition of marine cations to the medium.
Oxidase- and catalase-positive, unable to reduce nitrates.
Predominant fatty acids are iso-C15 : 0, iso-C15 : 1 G and the major hydroxylated fatty acid is iso-C17 : 0 3-OH.
Polar lipids include PE and other unidentified lipids.
The DNA G+C content is around 40 mol%.
The type species is Euzebyella saccharophila.
